definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.english: They know mores than the Kamasutra.
sentences.chinese: 他们想得到的姿势比印度爱经都多。

sentences.english: They know more positions than the Kamasutra.
sentences.chinese: 他们想得到的姿势比印度爱经都多。

sentences.english: Forget about Kama Sutra, missionary style is all you can expect.
sentences.chinese: 忘掉《爱经》吧，有传教士式就不错了。

sentences.english: Kamasutra. The. Indian. Art. of. Lovemaking.
sentences.chinese: 古印度爱经之爱爱的艺术。

sentences.english: Nearly every fifth-former thumbs their way through the Kamasutra.
sentences.chinese: 前者中有几近五分之一的人通过爱经寻找他们的道路。

sentences.english: Appears prominently in the Kama Sutra and often used in the practise of tantric sex.
sentences.chinese: 它醒目地出现在《爱经》中，并常常用于密宗性活动。

sentences.english: Remember everything you knew at 22 and don't learn anything more.
sentences.chinese: 记住你22岁所学的爱经即可，不用多学妙招。

definition: volumes of classics/volumes of scriptures/ancient scrolls
Mahābhārata, second great Indian epic after 羅摩衍那|罗摩衍那[Luo2 mo2 yan3 na4], possibly originally c. 4th century BC
Pali, language of Theravad Pali canon
Classic on Medical Problems, c. 1st century AD/abbr. for 黃帝八十一難經|黄帝八十一难经[Huang2 di4 Ba1 shi2 yi1 Nan4 jing1]
Great Tang Records on the Western Regions, travel record of Xuan Zang 玄奘[Xuan2 zang4], compiled by 辯機|辩机[Bian4 ji1] in 646
Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
